gov.lanl.adore.djatoka

Interface DjatokaConstants

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DjatokaDecodeParam, DjatokaEncodeParam

    public interface DjatokaConstants
    Default values from djatoka.properties. As detailed below, many of these default values are derived from the Kakadu Library usage examples. The slope method is used by default as it ensures a compression ratio appropriate for the content (e.g illuminated manuscript) and balances quality with compression.

    Excerpts from Kakadu Usage_Examples.txt from which many of the default values were obtained:

    kdu_compress -i massive.ppm -o massive.jp2 -rate -,0.001 Clayers=28 Creversible=yes Clevels=8 Corder=PCRL ORGgen_plt=yes Cprecincts={256,256},{256,256},{128,128},{64,128},{32,128}, {16,128},{8,128},{4,128},{2,128} -flush_period 1024

    You might use this type of command to compress a really massive image, e.g. 64Kx64K or larger, without requiring the use of tiles. The code-stream is incrementally flushed out using the `-flush_period' argument to indicate that an attempt should be made to apply incremental rate control procedures and flush as much of the generated data to the output file as possible, roughly every 1024 lines. The result is that you will only need about 1000*L bytes of memory to perform all relevant processing and code-stream management, where L is the image width. It follows that a computer with 256MBytes of RAM could losslessly an image measuring as much as 256Kx256K without resorting to vertical tiling. The resulting code-stream can be efficiently served up to a remote client using `kdu_server'. kdu_transcode -i in.j2c -o out.j2c Cprecincts={128,128} Corder=RPCL ORGgen_plt=yes You can use something like this to create a new code-stream with all the information of the original, but having an organization (and pointer marker segments) which will enable random access into the code-stream during interactive rendering. The introduction of precincts, PLT marker segments, and a "layer-last" progression sequence such as RPCL, PCRL or CPRL, can also improve the memory efficiency of the "kdu_server" application when used to serve up a very large image to a remote client. If the image is small to moderate in size (say up to 1K by 1K), it is recommended that you compress the original image using 32x32 code-blocks (Cblk={32,32}) instead of the default 64x64 code-blocks. This can be helpful even for very large images, but if the original uncompressed image size is on the order of 1 Gigabyte or more, larger code-blocks will help reduce the internal state memory resources which the server must dedicate to the client connection.

    Author:
    Ryan Chute

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CBLK
      Defines default codeblock size.
      static int DEFAULT_CLAYERS
      Number of quality layers, must correspond with number of slope values Default Value: "6"
      static int DEFAULT_CLEVELS
      Number of DWT Levels (i.e. resolutions) Default Value: "0". 0 indicates application should determine value.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CORDER
      Preferred progression order.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CPRECINCTS
      Defines the size of the layer packets.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_JPEG2K_PROP_FILENAME
      Defined the file name of the default compression props file.
      static boolean DEFAULT_ORGGEN_PLT
      Boolean indicator of whether or not packet organization header info should be included.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_ORGTPARTS
      Preferred order of header information.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_RATE
      Absolute Compression Rate.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_SLOPE
      Relative Compression Slope used to generate a compression level per layer.
      static boolean DEFAULT_USE_REVERSIBLE
      Boolean indicator of whether or not a reversible compression wavelet should be used.

      • DEFAULT_RATE

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_RATE
        Absolute Compression Rate. Default Value: "1.0"

        Number of quality layers, must correspond with number of slope values Default Value: "6"

        Boolean indicator of whether or not a reversible compression wavelet should be used. Default Value: true

        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CPRECINCTS

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_CPRECINCTS
        Defines the size of the layer packets. Default values improve random access performance. Default Value: "{256,256},{256,256},{128,128}"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CORDER

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_CORDER
        Preferred progression order. Default values improve resolution access performance. Default Value: "RPCL"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_ORGGEN_PLT

        static final boolean DEFAULT_ORGGEN_PLT
        Boolean indicator of whether or not packet organization header info should be included. Default Value: true

      • DEFAULT_ORGTPARTS

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_ORGTPARTS
        Preferred order of header information. Default values improve resolution access performance. Default Value: "R"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_CBLK
        Defines default codeblock size. Default Value: "{32,32}"
